  physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features four women . All of them are sitting down and they are looking towards the direction in which the photograph was taken. A balustrade is situated behind them. They are all dressed in their ethnic costumes as well.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows four nyonyas seated before a balustrade.

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
